intro: Coccoloba parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or purple berries that are a key feature of its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. Due to its attractive foliage and fruit, it is cultivated in gardens and used in landscape design.
